summary: Improves and creates a unique enchant for the Rahgot Dragon Priest Mask, to make it worthy of being called an artifact.
descriptionHtml:
SE Note: I will likely replicate this mod once the new CK is out.

tl;dr: This is a mod I made for myself primarily, to provide Heavy Armor characters with a mask worth a damn. And the vanilla Rahgot mask was just laughable. This is intended to be a fair and balanced mod. Comments/suggestions are welcome. Endorse if you like it! :)

Compatible with or without Dawnguard; this mod makes no exclusive changes.

===========
Description
===========
The Rahgot Dragon Priest Mask uses a basic Fortify Stamina enchant, which can be done by any Joe Schmoe at an Enchanter's Station. In fact, it could very well be done BETTER by a decent enchanter. Since all of the Dragon Priest Masks are artifacts with unique properties unavailable to the player character, using either unenchantable bonuses or 3 enchants on one item, this mod brings the Rahgot mask in line with its counterparts.

========
Changes
========
Vanilla: Increases your stamina by 70 points.

This Mod: Stamina regenerates 50% faster, and time between shouts is reduced by 20%.

============
Compatibility
============
Anything that edits the Rahgot mask, ArmorDragonPriestMaskOrichalumHelmet, will not work with this mod.

==========
Installation
==========
Install: Use NexusModManager, or drag the .ESP file into your data folder, and activate through the launcher.

Uninstall: Deactivate/Delete the .ESP file.

=========
Reasoning
=========
Why 50% Stamina Rate? Because there are very few things that do this, and 50% is the highest number you will find on pre-enchanted items. Fortifying stamina is a common enchant. Fortifying the regen rate is rare.

Why 20% Reduced Shout Cooldown? The Morokei mask enchant provides 100% Magicka Regen, and 20% reduced shout cooldown. This gives melee characters an option to obtain a Fortify Shout buff in a Heavy Armor version. Finally, Fortify Shouts is an enchant unavailable to enchanters, putting the mask on par with the other masks (as noted above).
